org.jcvi.jillion.trace.fastq

Interface FastqRecord

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Defline, Trace
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommentedParsedFastqRecord, ParsedFastqRecord

    public interface FastqRecord
extends Trace, Defline
    FastqRecord is an object representation of a read from a fastq encoded file.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Object obj)
      Two FastqRecords are equal if and only if they have equal ids, NucleotideSequences and QualitySequences.
      default OptionalDouble getAvgQuality()
      Get the average quality score as a double.
      String getComment()
      Get the comment (if any) associated with this record.
      String getId()
      Get the Id of this FastqRecord.
      default long getLength()
      Get the length of the nucleotide and quality sequences.
      NucleotideSequence getNucleotideSequence()
      Gets the NucleotideSequence of this record.
      QualitySequence getQualitySequence()
      Gets the QualitySequence of this record.
      int hashCode()
      The HashCode of a FastqRecord is computed using the id, NucleotideSequence and QualitySequence values.
      default FastqRecordBuilder toBuilder()
      Create a new FastqRecordBuilder instance using the values from this FastqRecord.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jcvi.jillion.core.Defline

        of, of

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Get the Id of this FastqRecord. Note: It is possible that this id has multiple "words" with whitespace in between if this record was from a CASAVA 1.8 run. This can cause problems with downstream software if whitespace in ids is not allowed.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface Defline
        Specified by:
        getId in interface Trace
        Returns:
        This id of this FastqRecord as a String

      • getNucleotideSequence

        NucleotideSequence getNucleotideSequence()
        Gets the NucleotideSequence of this record. The nucleotide sequence should be the same length as the QualitySequence returned by getQualitySequence().
        Specified by:
        getNucleotideSequence in interface Trace
        Returns:
        a NucleotideSequence instance; never null.

      • getQualitySequence

        QualitySequence getQualitySequence()
        Gets the QualitySequence of this record. The quality sequence should be the same length as the NucleotideSequence returned by getNucleotideSequence().
        Specified by:
        getQualitySequence in interface Trace
        Returns:
        a QualitySequence instance; never null.

      • getComment

        String getComment()
        Description copied from interface: Defline
        Get the comment (if any) associated with this record.
        Specified by:
        getComment in interface Defline
        Returns:
        A String of the comment or null if there is no comment.

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        The HashCode of a FastqRecord is computed using the id, NucleotideSequence and QualitySequence values.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        an int.

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object obj)
        Two FastqRecords are equal if and only if they have equal ids, NucleotideSequences and QualitySequences. Any comments returned by getComment() are ignored for equality testing.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the other object to compare.
        Returns:
        true if the other object is also a FastqRecord and has the same id, nucleotide and quality sequence.

      • getLength

        default long getLength()
        Get the length of the nucleotide and quality sequences. Both should be the same length.
        Specified by:
        getLength in interface Trace
        Implementation Requirements:
        the default implementation of this method calls getNucleotideSequence().getLength() but some FastqRecord implementations may optimize this return value.
        Returns:
        the length of this record sequence.
        Since:
        5.0

      • getAvgQuality

        default OptionalDouble getAvgQuality()
        Get the average quality score as a double. This calculation only works on a sequence that is not empty.
        Implementation Requirements:
        the default implementation of this method calls getQualitySequence().getAvgQuality() but some FastqRecord implementations may optimize this computation.
        Returns:
        the avg quality score as a double.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - if the sequence length is 0.
        Since:
        5.2

      • toBuilder

        default FastqRecordBuilder toBuilder()
        Create a new FastqRecordBuilder instance using the values from this FastqRecord.
        Implementation Requirements:
        the default implementation is the same as return new FastqRecordBuilder(this);
        Returns:
        a new FastqRecordBuilder instance will never be null.
        Since:
        5.3
